title: Newcomen Steam Engine
subtitle: Atmospheric engine for dewatering mines
resume: Thomas Newcomen builds the first practical steam-powered pump, a foundation for the Industrial Revolution.

title: Watt's Separate Condenser
subtitle: Thermal efficiency breakthrough
resume: James Watt improves the steam engine by adding a separate condenser, cutting energy losses dramatically.

title: Bessemer Process
subtitle: Mass steel production
resume: Henry Bessemer’s converter enables high-volume, lower-cost steel—transforming railways, bridges, and buildings.

title: Wright Flyer
subtitle: Controlled, sustained flight
resume: The Wright brothers achieve the first powered flight, opening the era of aeronautical engineering.

title: Transistor
subtitle: Solid-state revolution
resume: Bardeen, Brattain, and Shockley demonstrate the transistor, enabling modern electronics and computing.

title: Sputnik 1
subtitle: Space age begins
resume: The first artificial satellite intensifies systems engineering and rocketry, reshaping global technology.

title: ARPANET Link
subtitle: Packet switching milestone
resume: The first message is sent over ARPANET—an early step toward the modern Internet.

title: Intel 4004
subtitle: First commercial microprocessor
resume: A complete CPU on a chip catalyzes embedded systems and personal computing.

title: Space Shuttle STS‑1
subtitle: Reusable spacecraft
resume: Columbia’s launch advances materials, avionics, and mission operations engineering.

title: World Wide Web Proposal
subtitle: Hypertext for everyone
resume: Tim Berners‑Lee drafts a distributed hypertext system, laying the groundwork for the Web.
